com.bluegosling.collections

Class MoreStreams

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluegosling.collections.MoreStreams

  • public final class MoreStreams
extends Object
    Utility methods for working with and creating instances of Stream.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • zip

        public static <T,U,V> Stream<V> zip(Stream<? extends T> s1,
                                    Stream<? extends U> s2,
                                    BiFunction<? super T,? super U,? extends V> fn)
        Combines the given two streams into one by "zipping" them together. The first item from each stream is combined using the given function to produce the first item of the combined stream. The same goes for the second item and so on. When either stream is exhausted, the combined stream is also exhausted. So if one stream has more items than the other, the extra items in the longer stream are ignored.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first stream
        s2 - the second stream
        fn - the function used to combine the items from each stream into one
        Returns:
        a new stream that emits the result of "zipping" together items from the given streams

      • zip

        public static <T,U,V,W> Stream<W> zip(Stream<? extends T> s1,
                                      Stream<? extends U> s2,
                                      Stream<? extends V> s3,
                                      TriFunction<? super T,? super U,? super V,? extends W> fn)
        Combines the given three streams into one by "zipping" them together. The first item from each stream is combined using the given function to produce the first item of the combined stream. The same goes for the second item and so on. When any stream is exhausted, the combined stream is also exhausted. So if any stream has more items than the shortest, the extra items in the longer stream(s) are ignored.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first stream
        s2 - the second stream
        s3 - the third stream
        fn - the function used to combine the items from each stream into one
        Returns:
        a new stream that emits the result of "zipping" together items from the given streams

      • zip

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> Stream<List<T>> zip(Stream<? extends T>... streams)
        Combines the given array of streams into one by "zipping" them together. The first item is taken from each stream (in the given order) and put into a list. The first item of the combined stream is that list. The same is done for the second item and so on. When any stream is exhausted, the combined stream is also exhausted. So if any stream has more items than the shortest, the extra items in the longer stream(s) are ignored.

        If the given array has no streams (e.g. length is zero), the returned stream is empty.

        Parameters:
        streams - the streams to be combined
        Returns:
        a new stream that emits the result of "zipping" together items from the given streams into lists

      • zip

        public static <T> Stream<List<T>> zip(Iterable<? extends Stream<? extends T>> streams)
        Combines the given streams into one by "zipping" them together. The first item is taken from each stream (in the iteration order of the given iterable) and put into a list. The first item of the combined stream is that list. The same is done for the second item and so on. When any stream is exhausted, the combined stream is also exhausted. So if any stream has more items than the shortest, the extra items in the longer stream(s) are ignored.

        If the given iterable is empty, the returned stream is empty.

        Parameters:
        streams - the streams to be combined
        Returns:
        a new stream that emits the result of "zipping" together items from the given streams into lists
